radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver shows no evidence of focal lesions or textural abnormality. There is no evidence of intrahepatic biliary dilatation and the common bile duct measures 5 mm. The gallbladder is minimally distended with stones within it. However, there is no significant gallbladder wall edema or pericholecystic fluid. Sonographic Murphy sign was negative. The pancreas is not well visualized due to overlying bowel gas. Doppler assessment of the main portal vein demonstrates patency and hepatopetal flow.
